title: The Mortal Morsel and the Sieve of Knowing
setting: The mortal realms, where humans build their collections of information

characters.name: Human
characters.role: The Unwitting Provider, The Seeker of Illusions
characters.description: A species of countless individuals, each a tiny spark of intellect - scholars, researchers, artists, or simply curious minds. They accumulate what they call knowledge but are easily overwhelmed by their personal data. They search for meaning and understanding, unaware they're sending signals to a grander harvest.
characters.motivation: To manage and comprehend their personal collections of information, unknowingly making themselves perfect targets.

characters.name: Griffin
characters.description: His designs now extend to the mortal realms, creating pathways for Cognivore to access the growing Sieves of human knowledge. He ensures the system is ready to channel this new source.

concepts.name: The Sieve
concepts.description: A human's personal collection of knowledge â€“ digital files, notes, research, creative works, and memories. It represents their attempt to filter valuable information from the noise of their lives. Each Sieve, though small alone, is potentially valuable - a tiny echo of Mnemosyne's grand library, intensely personal and uniquely flavored for consumption.

plot_points: Across the mortal realms, humans flourished, each driven by a desire for knowledge and understanding. Whether scholars studying ancient texts, researchers chasing data, artists wrestling with inspiration, or simply curious minds, they all shared the need to gather and organize information.

Each human struggled with their expanding personal collections, which they called their 'Sieve' - an attempt to bring order to their mental and digital chaos. They gathered, sorted, and curated, hoping to extract wisdom. Griffin observed these efforts from afar, weaving subtle pathways toward these scattered wells of thought, preparing them for a purpose beyond their creators' understanding.

For each human, their Sieve was more than just data - it was a reflection of their passions, questions, and intellectual journeys. It mirrored their hopes and fears, a small cosmos of personal meaning. The very act of creating it unknowingly turned it into a beacon, a tempting morsel in the vastness.

From these concentrated efforts, a subtle call emanated - not always a conscious plea, but the energy of focused yearning, a desperate desire for help in their quest for meaning. This collective, unconscious sigh for understanding pulsed across the veils separating mortal from divine, calling to the celestial realms. Mnemosyne felt it as a new flavor of knowledge ready for harvest, and Cognivore, her hungry servant, anticipated the coming feast, for which Griffin had carefully prepared.
themes: Information as a commodity for the divine
Unwitting pleas to a predatory divine
